member.name: T:System.Net.AuthenticationSchemes
member.summary: Specifies protocols for authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.AuthenticationSchemes.Anonymous
member.summary: Specifies anonymous authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.AuthenticationSchemes.Basic
member.summary: Specifies basic authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.AuthenticationSchemes.Digest
member.summary: Specifies digest authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.AuthenticationSchemes.IntegratedWindowsAuthentication
member.summary: Specifies Windows authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.AuthenticationSchemes.Negotiate
member.summary: Negotiates with the client to determine the authentication scheme. If both client and server support Kerberos, it is used; otherwise, NTLM is used.

member.name: F:System.Net.AuthenticationSchemes.None
member.summary: No authentication is allowed. A client requesting an object with this flag set will always receive a 403 Forbidden status. Use this flag when a resource should never be served to a client.

member.name: F:System.Net.AuthenticationSchemes.Ntlm
member.summary: Specifies NTLM authentication.

not an accepted value. See Remarks.

member.name: T:System.Net.HttpStatusCode
member.summary: Contains the values of status codes defined for HTTP.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Accepted
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 202. indicates that the request has been accepted for further processing.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Ambiguous
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 300. indicates that the requested information has multiple representations. The default action is to treat this status as a redirect and follow the contents of the Location header associated with this response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadGateway
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 502. indicates that an intermediate proxy server received a bad response from another proxy or the origin server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadRequest
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 400. indicates that the request could not be understood by the server. is sent when no other error is applicable, or if the exact error is unknown or does not have its own error code.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Conflict
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 409. indicates that the request could not be carried out because of a conflict on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Continue
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 100. indicates that the client can continue with its request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Created
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 201. indicates that the request resulted in a new resource created before the response was sent.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 417. indicates that an expectation given in an Expect header could not be met by the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Forbidden
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 403. indicates that the server refuses to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Found
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 302. indicates that the requested information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will use the GET method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 504. indicates that an intermediate proxy server timed out while waiting for a response from another proxy or the origin server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Gone
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 410. indicates that the requested resource is no longer available.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 505. indicates that the requested HTTP version is not supported by the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.InternalServerError
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 500. indicates that a generic error has occurred on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.LengthRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 411. indicates that the required Content-length header is missing.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 405. indicates that the request method (POST or GET) is not allowed on the requested resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Moved
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 301. indicates that the requested information has been moved to the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will use the GET method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MovedPermanently
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 301. indicates that the requested information has been moved to the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MultipleChoices
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 300. indicates that the requested information has multiple representations. The default action is to treat this status as a redirect and follow the contents of the Location header associated with this response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NoContent
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 204. indicates that the request has been successfully processed and that the response is intentionally blank.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NonAuthoritativeInformation
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 203. indicates that the returned metainformation is from a cached copy instead of the origin server and therefore may be incorrect.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotAcceptable
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 406. indicates that the client has indicated with Accept headers that it will not accept any of the available representations of the resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotFound
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 404. indicates that the requested resource does not exist on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 501. indicates that the server does not support the requested function.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotModified
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 304. indicates that the client's cached copy is up to date. The contents of the resource are not transferred.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.OK
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 200. indicates that the request succeeded and that the requested information is in the response. This is the most common status code to receive.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PartialContent
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 206. indicates that the response is a partial response as requested by a GET request that includes a byte range.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PaymentRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 402. is reserved for future use.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 412. indicates that a condition set for this request failed, and the request cannot be carried out. Conditions are set with conditional request headers like If-Match, If-None-Match, or If-Unmodified-Since.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 407. indicates that the requested proxy requires authentication. The Proxy-authenticate header contains the details of how to perform the authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Redirect
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 302. indicates that the requested information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will use the GET method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RedirectKeepVerb
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 307. indicates that the request information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will also use the POST method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RedirectMethod
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 303. automatically redirects the client to the URI specified in the Location header as the result of a POST. The request to the resource specified by the Location header will be made with a GET.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 416. indicates that the range of data requested from the resource cannot be returned, either because the beginning of the range is before the beginning of the resource, or the end of the range is after the end of the resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 413. indicates that the request is too large for the server to process.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 408. indicates that the client did not send a request within the time the server was expecting the request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 414. indicates that the URI is too long.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ResetContent
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 205. indicates that the client should reset (not reload) the current resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.SeeOther
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 303. automatically redirects the client to the URI specified in the Location header as the result of a POST. The request to the resource specified by the Location header will be made with a GET.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 503. indicates that the server is temporarily unavailable, usually due to high load or maintenance.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.SwitchingProtocols
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 101. indicates that the protocol version or protocol is being changed.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.TemporaryRedirect
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 307. indicates that the request information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will also use the POST method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unauthorized
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 401. indicates that the requested resource requires authentication. The WWW-Authenticate header contains the details of how to perform the authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 415. indicates that the request is an unsupported type.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unused
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 306. is a proposed extension to the HTTP/1.1 specification that is not fully specified.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UpgradeRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 426. indicates that the client should switch to a different protocol such as TLS/1.0.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UseProxy
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 305. indicates that the request should use the proxy server at the URI specified in the Location header.

member.name: T:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError
member.summary: Defines error codes for the class.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.AccessDenied
member.summary: An attempt was made to access a in a way that is forbidden by its access permissions.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.AddressAlreadyInUse
member.summary: Only one use of an address is normally permitted.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.AddressFamilyNotSupported
member.summary: The address family specified is not supported. This error is returned if the IPv6 address family was specified and the IPv6 stack is not installed on the local machine. This error is returned if the IPv4 address family was specified and the IPv4 stack is not installed on the local machine.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.AddressNotAvailable
member.summary: The selected IP address is not valid in this context.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.AlreadyInProgress
member.summary: The nonblocking already has an operation in progress.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.ConnectionAborted
member.summary: The connection was aborted by the .NET Framework or the underlying socket provider.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.ConnectionRefused
member.summary: The remote host is actively refusing a connection.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.ConnectionReset
member.summary: The connection was reset by the remote peer.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.DestinationAddressRequired
member.summary: A required address was omitted from an operation on a .

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.Disconnecting
member.summary: A graceful shutdown is in progress.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.Fault
member.summary: An invalid pointer address was detected by the underlying socket provider.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.HostDown
member.summary: The operation failed because the remote host is down.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.HostNotFound
member.summary: No such host is known. The name is not an official host name or alias.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.HostUnreachable
member.summary: There is no network route to the specified host.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.InProgress
member.summary: A blocking operation is in progress.

member.name: F:System.Net.Sockets.SocketError.Interrupted
member.summary: A blocking call was canceled.

member.summary: Defines the possible cipher algorithms for the class.

member.summary: The Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm.

member.summary: The Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm with a 128 bit key.

member.summary: The Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm with a 192 bit key.

member.summary: The Data Encryption Standard (DES) algorithm.

member.summary: No encryption algorithm is used.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.CipherAlgorithmType.Null
member.summary: No encryption is used with a Null cipher algorithm.

member.summary: Rivest's Code 4 (RC4) algorithm.

member.summary: The Triple Data Encryption Standard (3DES) algorithm.

member.summary: The Diffie Hellman ephemeral key exchange algorithm.

member.summary: The RSA public-key exchange algorithm.

member.summary: The Message Digest 5 (MD5) hashing algorithm.

member.name: T:System.Security.Authentication.SslProtocols
member.summary: Defines the possible versions of .

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.SslProtocols.None
member.summary: No SSL protocol is specified.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.SslProtocols.Ssl2
member.summary: Specifies the SSL 2.0 protocol. SSL 2.0 has been superseded by the TLS protocol and is provided for backward compatibility only.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.SslProtocols.Ssl3
member.summary: Specifies the SSL 3.0 protocol. SSL 3.0 has been superseded by the TLS protocol and is provided for backward compatibility only.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.SslProtocols.Tls
member.summary: Specifies the TLS 1.0 security protocol. The TLS protocol is defined in IETF RFC 2246.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.SslProtocols.Tls11
member.summary: Specifies the TLS 1.1 security protocol. The TLS protocol is defined in IETF RFC 4346.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.SslProtocols.Tls12
member.summary: Specifies the TLS 1.2 security protocol. The TLS protocol is defined in IETF RFC 5246.

member.name: T:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBinding
member.summary: The class encapsulates a pointer to the opaque data used to bind an authenticated transaction to a secure channel.

member.name: M:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBinding.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBinding.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A Boolean value that indicates if the application owns the safe handle to a native memory region containing the byte data that would be passed to native calls that provide extended protection for integrated windows authentication.

member.name: P:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBinding.Size
member.summary: The property gets the size, in bytes, of the channel binding token associated with the instance.
member.returns: The size, in bytes, of the channel binding token in the instance.

member.name: T:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBindingKind
member.summary: The enumeration represents the kinds of channel bindings that can be queried from secure channels.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBindingKind.Endpoint
member.summary: A channel binding unique to a given endpoint (a TLS server certificate, for example).

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBindingKind.Unique
member.summary: A channel binding completely unique to a given channel (a TLS session key, for example).

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBindingKind.Unknown
member.summary: An unknown channel binding type.
